snippet: Some parts of the Dodd-Frank Act may already need renovation or even repeal, but the problem is that possible replacements are unlikely to work or to be politically feasible.
abstract: Some parts of the Dodd-Frank Act may already need renovation or even repeal, but the problem is that possible replacements are unlikely to work or to be politically feasible.

headline.main: Despite Its Problems, Dodd-Frank Is Better Than the Alternatives
headline.print_headline: Weighing the Dodd-Frank Restrictions Against the Power of Big Banks

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
